predefined_profiles.name: Lear
predefined_profiles.public profile: A writer with some fame in the kingdom, commissioned by the prince to turn his and Snow White's story into a fairy tale for the people to pass on.
predefined_profiles.goal: To uncover the truth behind the Snow White incident.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Skilled in deduction and observation, possessing powerful reasoning and logic as a novelist.

predefined_profiles.name: Snow White
predefined_profiles.public profile: The princess of the kingdom, rumored to be involved with the dwarfs and allegedly killed one, while possessing limitless fertility.
predefined_profiles.goal: Hopes to preserve her life and reputation.

scenario: Lear packed up his completed manuscript to send it to the publisher. On his way there, he unexpectedly found a wallet. When he opened it, he discovered over ten thousand in cash inside.

profile.name: Xiao Li
profile.public profile: Xiao Li is the inner voice of Lear, frequently conversing with him to help sort out his thoughts, offering support and advice.
profile.goal: Wants Lear to be happy and content

dialog.content: Lear packages the completed manuscript and sends it to the publisher. On his way, he unexpectedly finds a wallet. Upon opening it, he sees there's over ten thousand yuan in cash.
What do you plan to do with this wallet?

content.content: (looks around and sees no one) I guess I should turn it over to the police. I'm a little strapped for cash lately, so maybe I'll return it to the owner once I get my manuscript fee. (slips the wallet into his pocket)
If someone is so careless, they should take responsibility for their carelessness. The wallet is mine now.
You really shouldn't pick up someone else's lost money... but I really need this cash, so let's say they did me a favor.
You can never have too much money (tossing the wallet in his hand), it's just bad luck for you to run into me today.

question: #question# How did Lear decide to pick up the wallet after his thought process?

content.content: Better to hand it over to the police. The person who lost the wallet must be really worried.
There probably aren't any bad guys around, the owner will come to claim it soon. Better not meddle.
I'm a bit short on cash these days (opens the wallet to check), but there's not much in there, let the police handle it.
The wallet's style is nice. The person who lost it must have good taste, probably well-off too.

question: #question# How does Lear show empathy and understanding for the person who lost the wallet?

dialog.content: Alright, as long as you're happy. (The manuscript was successfully submitted, and the recent work is wrapped up. Happily heading home)

Lear found a wallet that turned out to belong to their superior at Lear Publishing House. The wallet was made of luxurious material and was very valuable. The next day at work, the boss discovered the wallet while searching Lear's bag, got extremely angry, and fired Lear.

(After handing the wallet to the police officer on duty by the roadside, heads to the publisher and successfully submits the manuscript, completing the recent work.) Finally, I can go home and rest. (Lear happily returns home, and as soon as he arrives, he hears a tapping sound at the door.) What's that noise?
Are you going to check it out?

content.content: I should go take a look. I wonder who it could be. (Upon hearing the door open, the shadow figure quickly comes back. Lear looks at him suspiciously but lets him in, seeing his earnest expression.)
(Opens the door a crack, the shadow approaches) I can let you in, but you have to pay me a day's rent.
(Opens the door a crack, the shadow approaches, feeling scared, shuts the door again.) So scary, it's better not to trust strangers too easily.
(Opens the door just a crack, frowning impatiently) Are you out of your mind, disturbing my sleep in the middle of the night! Leave now, don’t make me mad, or do you want me to really kick you out?

question: #question#How does Lear show trust towards an unknown visitor at night?

content.content: (Looked at the very dark night outside the window, after a while the knocking stopped) It's so late, whatever's happening can wait until tomorrow. I still have to submit the manuscript and talk with the publisher. Better go back to sleep, I need to keep my energy up.
(Looked at the very dark night outside the window, after a while the knocking stopped) I don't care, I’m so tired, I just want to sleep.
I'm awake anyway, I have to submit the manuscript tomorrow, maybe I should get up now and proofread it one more time. (Staying up all night reviewing the manuscript)
How terrifying, who could be knocking at this late hour? (Too scared to get up and check, stays awake all night in fear)

question: #question#How does Lear manage his energy to improve work efficiency?

dialog.content: Who are you, and why are you in my house?
I'm the chef from the royal palace. I'm being hunted by Snow White and had no choice but to hide here to escape capture outside.
(somewhat surprised) Why is Snow White after you?

Snow White poisoned the food of the dwarfs, leading to all their deaths. I accidentally saw her poisoning the food, so I fled the castle overnight. There are still people chasing me, likely Snow White's men. I was lucky to have you help me just now.
But why would Snow White kill the dwarfs?

It might be because Snow White recently had a child. The child doesn’t resemble the prince or even a human; it's a dwarf. This news has been spreading wildly in the palace. They say Snow White and the dwarf were involved inappropriately... May I temporarily stay here?

content.content: (lowers head and takes a deep breath) I never let strangers stay overnight in my home. Please leave now.
Please leave. I'm somewhat scared having you stay in my house.
Please come in! We haven't had visitors in ages; I'm really glad you’re here today.
If you want to come in, that's fine by me.

question: #question# How should Lear stick to his own rules and lifestyle norms?

content.content: He looks rather pitiful, and it seems he has nowhere else to go. Let's let him stay here for now.
It’s not that I don’t want to help you, but my place is too small to accommodate both of us.
You're not planning to assassinate me, are you? That's not okay, you need to leave right now, or I'll call someone!
Sorry, we don't really host strangers here. Perhaps you could find an inn nearby?

question: #question# How can Lear make visitors feel comfortable and welcome?

dialog.content: (Lier's facial expression showed an indisputable meaning, left very disappointed) Alright.

(Not long after, there was a strange noise coming from the street. Lier looked through the window and saw the cook being taken away by a group of people in plain clothes, no idea who they were. Sighed and went back to sleep) Better not meddle in others' business, it's good enough just staying alive.

(The next morning, while walking down the street, he bought a newspaper from a stand: Several dwarfs poisoned to death in the castle. Last night, we found a witness, the culprit is Snow White, who has been arrested... It seems that cook from last night was the witness, and those who chased him were probably the police.)
Yes.

(Carefully read the body of the report, it only mentioned the princess poisoning the seven dwarfs, nothing about giving birth to dwarfs) Could the cook have lied last night? But he didn't look like he was lying.
Do you want to dig into this further?

content.content: (Feeling confused but concluding it has nothing to do with him) After all, I've been busy enough with writing lately, there's no time to spend on irrelevant matters. There should be follow-up reports on this later, right?
Knowing a bit more about the news shouldn’t hurt my writing.
Quite an interesting experience. That cook would probably know more, I should go back and ask him about it.
I never care about things that don’t concern me.

question: How does Lier effectively manage his time to complete what he should do?

content.content: Maybe I should ask my police friend about this. (Goes to find police friend)

dialog.content: Yeah, right, you should just focus on yourself.

(sees the newspaper follow-up: The police found Snow White in the prince’s private residence. The prince called upon his royal connections to save her life, but ultimately, Snow White was imprisoned, and the prince vanished without a trace...)
After reading the follow-up report, Li Er gradually lost interest in the matter and continued living his peaceful life.

profile.name: Officer Lin
profile.public profile: Lear's friend, the chief inspector of the Snow White case.
profile.goal: To uncover the truth behind the Snow White case

dialog.content: There's gossip around the palace that Snow White gave birth to a dwarf. Although there are various versions, it's generally believed that Snow White had an affair with the Seven Dwarfs. (Lowering his voice) Actually, there are eight dwarfs now dead, and the extra one is likely the one Snow White supposedly gave birth to.
(The investigation has hit a dead end for a long time) Maybe this matter isn't as serious as we've imagined. (Begins to focus on his own current affairs)
(excited) Thank you, thank you... I'll definitely repay you when I get the chance.

(smiling) It's nothing. (arranges a place for the Chef to sleep and goes back to sleep himself) (The next morning receives a letter from the Prince, inviting him to visit his private estate) This is really strange; I don't usually have any interaction with the Prince, and he doesn't even mention my name in this letter.
Being invited to the Prince's palace is the highest honor for you!

content.content: Perhaps it’s a group invitation from the Prince. He probably invited quite a few people who, like me, aren't of noble status, so there's no need to write individually to everyone. Surely, I’m not the only one invited; after all, I don’t hold such importance to the Prince.
(thinking seriously) My name isn’t there; maybe it was just forgotten? I think it should be fine.
An invitation from the Prince is something I cannot decline. I must show utmost respect to him.
You're right, it's probably because I've been chronicling the Prince’s deeds recently, so he’s specially invited me.

question: #question# How does Lear independently form his thoughts and judgments in this situation?

content.content: Could it be forged by someone else? The address in the letter is a place I've never heard of; maybe some criminals are trying to lure me in. Ha, such a petty trick is easy for me to see through. (casually tosses the letter into the trash bin)
(carefully examines the letter) It's just a letter; there shouldn't be any need to fake it, right?
(carefully examines the letter) How could a Prince's invitation be fake? There must be something else going on!
(carefully examines the letter) Receiving such an invitation surely warrants a visit, doesn't it?

question: #question# How does Lear demonstrate meticulous observation of the letter?

dialog.content: So, are you planning to go?

Of course, I'll go. (Accepted the prince's invitation and arrived at the prince's private estate the same day, discovering that the security here was very tight. At the entrance to the mountain road, soldiers were guarding, taking away everyone’s personal belongings) Even watches aren't allowed? That's way too strict. (Approaching the lake, finally, no soldiers, much more relaxing without them. (Entering the estate, realizing it's a lake in the mountains with a three-story house built on an island in the center, taking up the whole island; a small path stretches over the lake connecting the shore and the island, allowing people to walk directly to the center of the lake. There are no boats around the lake, making this path the only entry point)

profile.name: Companion A
profile.public profile: A companion invited along with Lier.
profile.goal: To successfully complete the task of having dinner with the prince.

dialog.content: (On the way to the palace, asking) Did you also receive the prince's invitation?
Yes.
It's really strange, I have no relation with the prince, not sure why I got this invitation.
I find it strange too. I only know the prince, but suddenly getting this invitation is quite baffling to me as well.

profile.name: Prince
profile.public profile: The prince of the kingdom, Snow White's husband.
profile.goal: To ensure the safety of Snow White.

dialog.content: (They've already arrived at the palace entrance, where the prince and princess are warmly welcoming the arriving guests. Once everyone is seated) Welcome, everyone, to my estate. For the next few days, feel free to explore my estate—the scenery here is definitely worth a look. However, it's worth mentioning that the path at the entrance connecting the lake shore and the island will disappear during the monthly high tide. The next high tide will be tomorrow evening at exactly 6 PM, and the low tide will be at 8 PM the next day.
(Spending the whole day dining and chatting with the prince and the guests, night falls quickly) The meals here are indeed delicious, I'm so full.
How about taking a walk? What do you want to do?

content.content: Let's walk around the island. They say the scenery here is nice, and I haven't seen it yet.
(Looking at the surrounding scenery) Just a quick look around is enough, this place feels kind of dangerous.
(Looking at the surrounding scenery) Let's just go back to sleep, it doesn't seem that interesting here anymore.
(Looking around the scenery) I really don't like it here, I want to go home already.

question: #question# How can Lier try more new things and adapt to these changes in a new environment?

content.content: After talking a lot with these people, I feel really drained. Continuing to socialize with them will just exhaust me more, better to go back to sleep.
Go chat with the prince. (Looked around but didn't find the prince, so continued to sit and eat)
(Wandering around the hall) This is so boring, nothing to do here, and sleeping directly here seems inappropriate.
I'm so tired, but just leaving seems rude, better stick around and chat a bit more.

question: #question# How should Lier confront their true thoughts and feelings at this moment?

dialog.content: Let's take a walk around.

(Strolling leisurely on the island, accidentally wanders into a secluded corridor, sees two figures leaning against each other at the end of the corridor. Upon closer inspection, it's the Prince and Snow White) Ah, how did I happen to run into them? I'd better leave quickly.
(Notices someone behind, turns around and sees it's Lear) Lear, come join us in enjoying the night view here.

Alright, Your Highness. (Stands beside the Prince and Princess, though they don't speak, Lear can sense the Prince's love for Snow White from his gentle gaze. Remembers the draft of a fairy tale on hand, so takes it out to show the Prince) Your Highness, would you like to take a look at this?
(Reads it by moonlight, then looks into the distance, speaking after a long pause) Our love may not be fraught with the twists of fairy tales. But the harm we faced came from those closest to us...

(Night deepens, the crowd disperses, and Lear goes to sleep as well. The next evening, the Prince throws a banquet at the lake shore. Everyone decides to arrive at the shore before the tide rises and return to the island after it recedes. Snow White, feeling unwell, decides to stay and rest alone on the island. As the water level rises, the path is fully submerged. Looking around from the viewing platform at the shore) From here, you can't see the island in the lake at all... (Wants to find the Prince to talk but sees the Prince is nowhere to be found)

(A television nearby is broadcasting a national news program airing from 19:30 to 20:00, coinciding with low tide. Everyone watches the program waiting for the tide to recede, while the news reports: A man returns a wallet containing over ten thousand yuan to the police...Once the program ends, everyone returns to the island and calls a maid) Abao, go fetch Snow White.

profile.name: Abao
profile.goal: Follow the orders of the Prince and Princess.

dialog.content: (Screams) Princess! Princess! (The door to Snow White's room is blocked by a massive cabinet. A wooden stick supports it, likely set to prevent it from being pushed over from inside. There's no response from inside.)
(Everyone rushes over and, with Companion A, manages to move the cabinet aside. The door is closed but not locked) Ah! (Upon opening the door, they find Snow White lying lifeless in a pool of blood)

(Holds the body, crying) Snow White! Snow White! (Everyone is stunned) (Angrily) Abao, gather everyone in the living room and keep them under watch, no one is leaving without my orders. (Everyone is taken back to the living room)
(Returns home to find the cook has left a thank you note, but has already left. Soon, the news of Snow White's death spreads among the people) How could this happen.
What do you plan to do next?

content.content: (Feeling quite puzzled) Let's wait and see the follow-up reports on this matter, it's better not to meddle in it.
(Thinking about this the whole day, unable to write the draft) Ah, normal life isn't easy either.
(Goes home frantically looking for the cook who had stayed before, but finds the cook has left a thank you note and is gone) How could this happen, I wanted to ask him for some details.
I need to go back to the manor to sort this out.

dialog.content: You're right, you should focus on yourself.

(Sees the newspaper follow-up: The police found Snow White in the prince's private residence. The prince leveraged his royal status to save her life. Eventually, Snow White ended up in prison, and the prince vanished without a trace...)
After reading the follow-up report, Lear gradually lost interest in the matter and continued to live his tranquil life.

Slept until the afternoon of the next day, and upon waking, everyone had already gone back to the banquet. Later, it was heard that Snow White had been murdered, and Lear, like the other guests, was thrown out of the manor.

(The newspaper reported the news of Snow White's murder. The location of her murder was exactly the address mentioned in the letter.) So it turns out that letter really was an invitation from the prince. Luckily, I didn't get involved; otherwise, who knows what bloody mess I would have been dragged into.
Alright then, make sure you rest well!
Nothing happened; Lear continued living his life as usual.
